image.altText: A still from a Snapchat video shows a baby on a bouncer crying.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into for-profit childcare giant Affinity Education highlights ongoing systemic issues around staffing, oversight and safety inside the billion-dollar enterprise.

title.children: Video captures childcare worker hitting baby and laughing about it

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelensky, Keir Starmer and Emmanuel Macron stand at Memorial Wall of Fallen Defenders of Ukraine

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president says he will travel to Türkiye this week to meet his Russian counterpart, hours after Donald Trump said he was beginning to doubt Ukraine wanted to end the war.

title.children: Zelenskyy agrees to meet Putin face-to-face for Ukraine war talks

image.altText: Jim Chalmers walks into QT smiling.

props.synopsis: Is Albanese up for it? Does Chalmers have a "passion for bold policy" to indulge? Does the country need it?

title.children: Australia's economy is a basket case again. Will Jim Chalmers take it on?

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and white open necked shirt sits in a restaurant smiling

props.synopsis: Robert Pether was jailed more than four years ago on what his family says were trumped-up charges, and there are concerns he has now developed lung cancer.

title.children: Family fears Australian 'in constant agony' in Iraqi jail has only weeks to live

image.altText: A screenshot of the face of a man in a video.

props.synopsis: The militant group's leader made the announcement on social media, but it's not clear when the release will occur.

title.children: Breaking: Hamas says it will release American-Israeli hostage

image.altText: The pope reads out an address in front of a red backdrop

props.synopsis: Pope Leo XIV has called on the world's powers to end major conflicts, in his first Sunday message to masses of faithful followers in St Peter's Square since his election as pontiff.

title.children: 'No more war': New pope appeals for peace in first Sunday address to crowds

image.altText: Anthony shakes hands with young people in a pub.

props.synopsis: Post-election analysis showed back in 2022 that the conservative side of politics was failing to attract younger voters. Why didn't it heed the warnings?

title.children: The Coalition has a young person problem

image.altText: An Indian security personnel officer standing in front of metal roller doors wearing camouflage clothing and holding a rifle

props.synopsis: The pause took effect after four days of intense fighting between the nuclear-armed neighbours, in the worst conflict involving India and Pakistan since 1999.

title.children: India-Pakistan truce appears to hold after early violation claims

image.altText: Women march in a protest outside as one holds a sign which reads: "There is no caste in blood be a human"

props.synopsis: India's caste system is 3,000 years old and continues to determine the opportunities that most of the country's 1.4 billion people have, from work to marriage.

title.children: 'The naked truth': India to include caste in census in 100-year first

image.altText: Ed Husic, wearing a suit, sitting on a green bench.

props.synopsis: Dumped cabinet minister Ed Husic says his decision to speak out on the conflict in Gaza was partly to blame for him being dropped from the frontbench, while also lashing Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles as a political "assassin".

title.children: Dumped minister accuses Richard Marles of being a 'factional assassin'

image.altText: Headshot of Paula and Bridgette Powers

props.synopsis: Bridgette and Paula Powers's in-sync interview about a gunman triggered global curiosity and countless parodies. Australian Story was filming behind the scenes with the Twinnies when Hollywood came calling.

title.children: Behind the scenes of the Twinnies' viral moment

image.altText: An aerial shot of the 20-storey mural on the Collingwood public housing tower.

props.synopsis: Victoria must build 80,000 new social housing homes over the next decade just to catch up to the national average, according to new data released by housing advocates.

title.children: Victoria facing 'human catastrophe' without social housing fix

image.altText: Women playing cricket

props.synopsis: These women are enjoying learning to play cricket, but their club doesn't have adequate facilities for them.

title.children: These cricketers turn up in their gear 'or get dressed in the car'

image.altText: Jake Riccardi celebrates a goal as Mark Blicavs looks disappointed

props.synopsis: GWS finds a way to beat Geelong again, recording a gripping four-point win over the Cats at Kardinia Park while North Melbourne and Brisbane play out a pulsating draw in Hobart.

title.children: Giants conquer Cats again in thriller as Roos hold Lions to pulsating draw

image.altText: Jahreem Bula looks at the Storm celebrating

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall has slammed his side after a horror 64-0 thrashing at the hands of Melbourne Storm, with Ryan Papenhuyzen scoring four tries. Later, the Sharks survived a late Sea Eagles comeback to claim a 30-14 victory at Brookvale.

title.children: Benji Marshall slams woeful Wests Tigers after Storm thrashing

image.altText: A stage set of a motel room; an Indigenous woman sits on the bed; a painting of a ship hangs on the wall

props.synopsis: Andrea James's powerful new play, The Black Woman of Gippsland, re-examines a problematic colonial legend and shows just how much work Australia still has to do to reckon with the past.

title.children: One of Australia's first deaths in custody explored in powerful new play

image.altText: A yellow flash of light in the sky.

props.synopsis: A bright light that lit up the sky over parts of Western Australia was most likely from a small meteor not much bigger than a cricket ball, experts say.

title.children: 'Incredibly special': Cricket-ball sized meteor lights up sky over parts of Western Australia

image.altText: aerial of outback town with salt pans and ranges in the distance

props.synopsis: Police say the woman in her 20s is assisting officers with their investigation into the death.

title.children: Man dies after altercation with woman in WA's Kimberley region

image.altText: Australian batter Bob Cowper kneels to put on his pads.

props.synopsis: Bob Cowper, who recorded the first Test triple century in Australia, dies at the age of 84.

title.children: Australian cricket mourns death of Test triple century maker Cowper

image.altText: Len Ainsworth poses for a portrait at a table in a dark room with poker machines behind him.

props.synopsis: Len Ainsworth built an empire on poker machines — devices that changed gambling forever. Over the last few decades, he's quietly shifted his attention, and power, towards philanthropy.

title.children: How one of Australia's richest families is rewriting its pokies legacy

image.altText: Donald trump in a suit with his fist in the air.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration is "actively looking at" suspending the constitutional right for people to legally challenge their detention by the government. So what is habeas corpus?

title.children: Trump is trying to suspend habeas corpus. He's not the first

image.altText: An older man and two younger men

props.synopsis: Prince Harry may be testing the thread of unconditional love that is supposed to connect a parent and child. But in royal life, that thread is stitched into a complicated tapestry, frayed by protocol, duty and terms set by the king.

title.children: Harry wants protection. The women who could help are the ones he's lost

image.altText: Mexican mothers day

props.synopsis: On a weekend mothers traditionally spend being showered with gifts and celebrated by their families, they are instead hitting the streets to protest against injustice and equality.

title.children: Mums around world spend Mother's Day fighting injustice

image.altText: albanese clean energy

props.synopsis: Hydrogen is not dead, and Labor's historic victory could change the global energy trade, economist Ross Garnaut says.

title.children: Economist says Labor's victory could change global energy trade

image.altText: A small baby in a pink onesie sleeps on a blue and yellow blanket.

props.synopsis: As the total ban on any humanitarian aid entering Gaza stretches into its third month, doctors warn babies are starving in hospitals.

title.children: Israel is keeping up its blockade of aid as kids starve to death

image.altText: Jack Della Maddalena celebrates winning UFC bout.

props.synopsis: Jack Della Maddalena becomes just the third Australian to win a UFC title after defeating long-time welterweight champion Belal Muhammad in Montreal.

title.children: Aussie Della Maddalena wins UFC welterweight crown

image.altText: Illustration showing pieces of a puzzle with the letter W and three figures pushing puzzle pieces into place

props.synopsis: In an age of polarisation and AI, the free online encyclopedia's very existence could be at stake.

title.children: Why Trump and his allies have Wikipedia in their sights

image.altText: People sit on seats on a brown boardwalk beside a river that has swans and rowers on it with Melbourne city buildings behind.

props.synopsis: Lord Mayor Nicholas Reece says the city’s ambitious plan to revitalise the Yarra River is not dead, despite it not being allocated any funding in this year’s council budget.

title.children: More red flags for ambitious Greenline project on the Yarra River

image.altText: Close up photo of Moran speaking into a microphone, wearing white collared shirt with dark suit jacket

props.synopsis: The Liberal candidate for Western Australia's new federal seat of Bullwinkel, Matt Moran, officially concedes defeat.

title.children: Liberal Party's Matt Moran concedes defeat in new WA seat of Bullwinkel

image.altText: Two booking photos provided by the California Department of Corrections shows Erik Menendez, left, and Lyle Menendez.

props.synopsis: Re-sentencing hearings for Erik and Lyle Menendez, who have spent 35 years in prison for killing their parents, are set to move forward in the US next week.

title.children: Menendez brothers resentencing set for next week

image.altText: Greg Thompson stands on a paved area in front of hedges with his hands in his pockets and a sullen look on his face..

props.synopsis: When Greg Thompson became bishop of Newcastle, he refused to turn a blind eye to the decades-long child sex abuse scandals in the diocese. For him, it was personal. He was himself a sexual abuse survivor. But speaking out came at huge cost.

title.children: The Anglican bishop who took on sexual abuse in the church

image.altText: Central Coast Mariners players embrace after reaching A-League Women grand final.

props.synopsis: Central Coast Mariners defeat Melbourne City 1-0, with Isabel Gomez controversially handing the premiers their sole defeat of the season in extra time.

title.children: Mariners shock Melbourne City to advance to A-League Women grand final

image.altText: Isobel Borlase dribbles the ball for the Opals.

props.synopsis: The Opals sweep the Trans-Tasman Throwdown series against the Tall Ferns, but the Boomers go down to their New Zealand opponents in Hamilton.

title.children: Opals outclass NZ as Boomers' comeback falls short

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair poses in a lush greenhouse surrounded by seedlings, while holding a basket of veggies.

props.synopsis: Dimity May's passion for gardening began during her maternity leave. It grew into a small business and inspired a move to regional Lutruwita/Tasmania with her young family.

title.children: Dimity moved to Tasmania for a quieter life. She's now busier than ever
